item.title: Erin add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Contradictions do not exist. Whenever you think that you are facing a contradiction, check your premises. You will find that one of them is wrong." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I can't think about that right now. If I do, I'll go crazy. I'll think about that tomorrow." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I'll think of it tomorrow, at Tara. I can stand it then. Tomorrow, I'll think of some way to get him back. After all, tomorrow is another day." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Dear Scarlett! You aren't helpless. Anyone as selfish and determined as you are is never helpless. God help the Yankees if they should get you." -Rhett Butler" -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "They are kind of queer about music and books and scenery. Mother says itâ€™s because their grandfather came from Virginia. She says Virginians set quite a store by such things." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Babies, babies, babies. Why did God make so many babies? But no, God didn't make them. Stupid people made them." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I wish to Heaven I was married," she said resentfully as she attacked the yams with loathing. "I'm tired of everlastingly being unnatural and never doing anything I want to do. I'm tired of acting like I don't eat more than a bird, and walking when I want to run and saying I feel faint after a waltz, when I could dance for two days and never get tired. I'm tired of saying, 'How wonderful you are!' to fool men who haven't got one-half the sense I've got, and I'm tired of pretending I don't know anything, so men can tell me things and feel important while they're doing it... I can't eat another bite." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Erin add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Great balls of fire. Don't bother me anymore, and don't call me sugar." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Erin add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Erin add a quote by Daniel Patrick Moynihan
item.description: "To be Irish is to know that in the end the world will break your heart." -- Daniel Patrick Moynihan

item.title: Erin add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description:
"THAT crazed girl improvising her music. Her poetry, dancing upon the shore,
Her soul in division from itself Climbing, falling She knew not where, Hiding amid the cargo of a steamship, Her knee-cap broken, that girl I declare A beautiful lofty thing, or a thing Heroically lost, heroically found.
No matter what disaster occurred She stood in desperate music wound, Wound, wound, and she made in her triumph Where the bales and the baskets lay No common intelligible sound But sang, 'O sea-starved, hungry sea" -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Erin add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "Moderation, we find, is an extremely difficult thing to get in this country." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Erin add a quote by Thomas Moore
item.description: "Though the last glimpse of Erin with sorrow I see, Yet wherever thou art shall seem Erin to me; In exile thy bosom shall still be my home, And thine eyes make my climate wherever we roam." -- Thomas Moore

item.title: Erin add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Dear old world', she murmured, 'you are very lovely, and I am glad to be alive in you." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Erin add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "So, this is my life. And I want you to know that I am both happy and sad and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Erin add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "And in that moment, I swear we were infinite." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Erin add a quote by Hilary Thayer Hamann
item.description: "Since he knew things at the beginning, maybe at the end he knew things too. That we had gone as far as chance would take us. That nothing is more sacred than youth or more hopeful than turning yourself over to someone and saying ~ I have this time, it is not a long time, but it is my best time and my best gift, and I give it to you. When I revisit my youth, I re-visit you." -- Hilary Thayer Hamann
